Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode

Still In Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem go away?

content:
Ciao, potrebbe esserci un problema di allineamento tra l'indice dei messaggi e gli archivi o nella coerenza di uno degli archivi stessi. Fai anzitutto un backup del tuo profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird

Poi esegui queste operazioni di manutenzione - Compattazione delle cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle - Riavvia Thunderbird - Ricostruzione dell'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale - Riavvia Thunderbird

content:
You can hide it by use of Custom CSS. I'm assuming that the right-most column you want to display is the date. However, it isn't really worth the bother as actual dates can stretch into the space underneath it. If you still want it gone here's how.

Firstly in Thunderbird go to Settings and scroll right to the end and click Config Editor. When that opens type:—

toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets

into the search box that appears — you probably won't have to finish typing before it shows in the list below. If its value is false, double-click the word false and it will change to true.

Now press Alt-H followed by Alt-I. Look down the blue block to the left of the screen that will open until you come to Profile Directory. Click the Open Directory button next to it. This will open your Profile Directory in Windows Explorer, or whatever file browser your system uses.

Make a directory/folder in that called chrome, all lower case. Now get into that and create a text file called userChrome.css, again all lower-case apart from the C in the middle.

Into that file put this:—

#dateColSplitter, .button-column-picker { display: none !important; }

You need to re-start Thunderbird for the change to actually take effect.
creator: thepillenwerfer

content:
Se stai parlando della PEC di Aruba, ci sono molte segnalazioni come la tua. La maggior parte dei problemi sono legati all'autenticazione a 2 fattori che spesso non funziona o smette di funzionare. Io posso solo rimandarti alla Guida di Aruba -> https://guide.pec.it/posta-pec/configurare-casella-pec/configurare-casella-pec-programma-posta.aspx

Non avendo un account PEC con loro non posso fare nessun tipo di controllo. Se fai una breve ricerca nel forum puoi trovare le varie discussioni sull'argomento. Te ne segnalo giusto un paio -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1442158 -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1410316

content:
It seems that something, possibly antivirus?, is keping thunderbird from updating the prefs.js file at exit. Those are the symptoms. If you view the profile from windows file explorer, you may see multiple copies of that file, representing continued failed attempts. if that's the situation, you might try this:

  1. exit thunderbird
  2. in the profile, delete prefs.js and all other copies except the one with the highest number, and then rename that one to prefs.js
  3. then, invetigate whatever is interrupting thunderbird
